issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Running valgrind --leak-check=yes ./cetest gives us this:
{noformat}
==14094== LEAK SUMMARY:
==14094==    definitely lost: 964,351 bytes in 1,154 blocks
==14094==    indirectly lost: 75,506 bytes in 3,777 blocks
==14094==      possibly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==14094==    still reachable: 554 bytes in 22 blocks
==14094==         suppressed: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==14094== Reachable blocks (those to which a pointer was found) are not shown.
==14094== To see them, rerun with: --leak-check=full --show-leak-kinds=all
==14094==
==14094== For counts of detected and suppressed errors, rerun with: -v
==14094== ERROR SUMMARY: 373 errors from 373 contexts (suppressed: 0 from 0)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Fix valgrind leak check on container executor

[~billie.rinaldi] Thank you for the patch.  This patch clean up a lot of memory leaks. +1
Thank you [~billie.rinaldi].  I just committed this to trunk.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14584 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14584/])
